page.title: 11Home life
page.content: The landscape, an undulating patchwork of hedgerowed fields, winding leafy lanes and collections of copses, is inset with farm buildings, many several years old in origin, steep roofed with tiles or thatch. Cottages have been renovated by people who work out of the region, usually by uniting several small terraced units into one 'executive' house. Retired people occupy those remaining in an original and sometimes decaying state. There are some modern style brick buildings, especially in Rushmere near the A12. Both Henstead and Rushmere have a group of utilitarian but soundly built council houses for those who cannot afford their own homes. The group sampled averaged 3 per household with 5 as a maximum. Being a rural community most of the population speak a Suffolk dialect.
